intro: Forsteronia fallax, commonly known as the Mexican poinsettia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is characterized by its striking, colorful bracts that resemble petals, which are actually modified leaves. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is known for its short blooming period during the winter months. Its true flowers are small and inconspicuous, located at the center of the bract cluster. Forsteronia fallax is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant foliage and seasonal display.
